intro: Ardisia oligantha, commonly known as the small-leaved beautyberry, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to tropical regions of the Americas, including parts of Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers that appear in clusters, followed by bright red berries that are a striking feature of the plant. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a glossy appearance. Ardisia oligantha is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and showy fruit.
